sub_topic: Identifying the isomorphism between two graphs.
message_2:
Graph A and Graph B are isomorphic. We can find an isomorphism between the two graphs by mapping the vertices of Graph A to the vertices of Graph B in such a way that the adjacency relationships are preserved.

One possible isomorphism is:

1 -> a
2 -> b
3 -> c
4 -> d
5 -> e

Under this mapping, the edges of Graph A correspond to the edges of Graph B as follows:

(1, 2) -> (a, b)
(1, 3) -> (a, c)
(2, 3) -> (b, c)
(2, 4) -> (b, d)
(3, 5) -> (c, e)

Since the adjacency relationships are preserved under this mapping, Graph A and Graph B are isomorphic.
